channel.title: BBC News - Wales

item.title: Llanelli boy 'didn't get enough support' from school before death
item.description: Byron John says his son Bradley "had a future that he wanted and yearned for".

item.title: LGBTQ: Wales' bid to be 'most friendly' nation in Europe
item.description: A new plan aims to make Wales "the most LGBTQ+ friendly" nation in Europe.

item.title: Olympics: Headstone bid for champion in unmarked grave
item.description: Cecil Griffiths died in poverty and his family could not afford a headstone for the relay winner.

item.title: Storm Evert: Yellow warning for wind on south Wales coast
item.description: A yellow warning for wind covers large parts of the south Wales coast on Thursday and Friday.

item.title: Death of Caerphilly lumberjack crushed by tree accidental
item.description: Ben Thomas was killed when a tree leaning against the one he had just cut down fell and crushed him.

item.title: Covid case rate falls for eighth consecutive day
item.description: Figures show 18 of Wales' 22 local authority areas are seeing a drop in case rates among under-25s.

item.title: Doctor Who: Jodie Whittaker and Chris Chibnall to leave in 2022
item.description: The star of the BBC sci-fi drama series will bow out with a trio of specials.

item.title: Snowdon: Two women hit by lightning at mountain summit
item.description: Rescuers said the pair were "very lucky" to be alive after being hit by a lightning on Snowdon.

item.title: Swindon pair found guilty of trafficking vulnerable women
item.description: Cristian Simion and Mihaela Borcos made about £70k after exploiting women who had come to the UK.

item.title: Climate change: Green energy barriers 'threaten' net zero goal
item.description: Problems starting renewable energy schemes could see firms bypass Wales, a group of MPs warn.

item.title: Woman died in Cardiff home after waiting 'hours' for ambulance
item.description: Maria Whale's husband John questioned whether his wife would have lived if help had come sooner.

item.title: LGBTQ people 'need to be part of' Wales' awareness push
item.description: It is hoped a new plan will see LGBTQ+ rights made mainstream across schools and the public sector.

item.title: Welsh slate landscape crowned a World Heritage site
item.description: The slate landscape of north-west Wales becomes the 32 UK site to be on Unesco's heritage list.

item.title: Woman who died in 'severe' pain at Cardiff home waited 'hours' for ambulance
item.description: John Whale's wife Maria died after they waited more than two hours for an ambulance.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Matt Richards’ parents ‘overwhelmed’ by gold medal
item.description: "We're just delighted for him", says Matt Richards' mother Amanda.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Team GB's Lauren Price reaches middleweight quarter-finals
item.description: Team GB's Lauren Price eases through the middleweight round of 16 at the Tokyo Olympics, beating Mongolian Munkhbat Myagmarjargal.

item.title: Pontyclun beer garden crash survivor 'happy to be alive'
item.description: Darren George said he is just "happy to be alive" despite breaking his leg and ankle in the crash.

item.title: South Africa v British & Irish Lions: Rassie Erasmus complains about refereeing in video monologue
item.description: South Africa boss Rassie Erasmus records an hour-long video monologue railing against the refereeing in his side's first-Test defeat by the British and Irish Lions.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Welsh swimming golden boy Matthew Richards targets more success
item.description: Welsh swimming Olympic champion Matthew Richards is already targeting more gold medal success in the pool.

item.title: Calum Jarvis: The fifth man of Team GB's 4x200m freestyle relay gold at Tokyo Olympics
item.description: He did not swim in the Olympic 4x200m freestyle relay final, but Calum Jarvis will return from Tokyo with a gold medal.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Athletes can light up Covid-hit Games, says Christian Malcolm
item.description: UK Athletics head coach Christian Malcolm says the stars of track and field can "light up" the Olympics after the challenges brought by Covid-19.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Welsh rower Victoria Thornley says anything can happen in final
item.description: Welsh rower Victoria Thornley reaches her third consecutive Olympic rowing final in her third different boat.

item.title: Richard Jones, cerddor a chyfansoddwr Ail Symudiad, wedi marw
item.description: Cerddor a chyfansoddwr grŵp Ail Symudiad, Richard Jones wedi marw, fis yn unig ar ôl ei frawd Wyn.

item.title: 'Dwi eisiau byw fy mywyd yn ddibryder fel pawb arall'
item.description: Sicrhau mai Cymru yw'r wlad fwyaf cyfeillgar i bobl LHDTC+ yn Ewrop yw nod Llywodraeth Cymru.

item.title: Torrwr coed wedi marw'n ddamweiniol, medd rheithgor
item.description: Bu farw Ben Thomas wrth dorri coed mewn coedwig yn Sir Caerffili bron i bedair blynedd yn ôl.

item.title: Ble mae Safleoedd Treftadaeth UNESCO Cymru?
item.description: Y mannau yng Nghymru sydd wedi ennill statws treftadaeth rhyngwladol

item.title: Morgannwg yn colli o un rhediad yn y Cwpan Undydd
item.description: Boddi wrth ymyl y lan wnaeth Morgannwg yn erbyn Gwlad yr Hâf ar ôl i law fyrhau'r gêm.
